page.title: 10GAMES & PASTIMES
page.content: Norris Bank School did a survey on what children did after school.Every family has a T.V. set and 66% more than one.Some had 4 or 5 sets. Computers and Videos were becoming more popular 66% had a Video and 58% had a Computer. Over half the children watched more than two hours T.V each day but less than half ever listened to a radio however 90% did some reading at home each night varying from 15 mins to two hours. Most popular T.V. programmes were cartoons with the young ones being a favourite of the top class. Tick or chasing remained top playground game with the Infants playing old favourites like mummies and daddies.Tennis ,Cricket and Soccer were top sports.
